question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Compute the smallest positive integer $x$ greater than 9 such that
\[\lfloor x \rfloor - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor = 9 = \lfloor x \rfloor - 89 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor.\]
inference:
\[\begin{split}\lfloor x \rfloor - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow x -19\left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow x-x+19\left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &=9+x-x \\\ \Rightarrow 19\left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &=\frac{9}{19} \\\ \Rightarrow \frac{x}{19} &<1 \\\ \Rightarrow x &< 19 \end{split}\]

\[\begin{split}\lfloor x \rfloor - 89 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow x -89\left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow x-x+89\left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9+x-x \\\ \Rightarrow 89\left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=\frac{9}{89} \\\ \Rightarrow \frac{x}{89} &<1 \\\ \Rightarrow x &< 89 \end{split}\]

Therefore, the only positive integer $x$ greater than \( 9 \) such that 
\[\lfloor x \rfloor - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor = 9 = \lfloor x \rfloor - 89 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor\]
is \( x = 10 \).
Final Answer: \boxed{10}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth:
Let $q$ and $r$ be the remainder when $x$ is divided by 19, so $x = 19q + r,$ where $0 \le r \le 18.$  Then
\begin{align*}
\lfloor x \rfloor - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &= 19q + r - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{19q + r}{19} \right\rfloor \\
&= 19q + r - 19 \left\lfloor q + \frac{r}{19} \right\rfloor \\
&= 19q + r - 19q \\
&= r.
\end{align*}Thus, when $x$ is divided by 19, the remainder is 9.  In other words, $x$ is 9 more than a multiple of 19.

Similarly, when $x$ is 9 more than a multiple of 89.  Since 19 and 89 are relatively prime, $x$ is 9 greater than a multiple of $19 \cdot 89 = 1691.$  Since $x$ is greater than 9, the smallest possible value of $x$ is $1691 + 9 = \boxed{1700}.$

\[\begin{split}\lfloor x \rfloor - 89 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow x -89\left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow x-x+89\left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9+x-x \\\ \Rightarrow 89\left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=9 \\\ \Rightarrow \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor &=\frac{9}{89} \\\ \Rightarrow \frac{x}{89} &<1 \\\ \Rightarrow x &< 89 \end{split}\]

Therefore, the only positive integer $x$ greater than \( 9 \) such that 
\[\lfloor x \rfloor - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor = 9 = \lfloor x \rfloor - 89 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{89} \right\rfloor\]
is \( x = 10 \).
Final Answer: \boxed{10}. I hope it is correct.

ground_truth:
Let $q$ and $r$ be the remainder when $x$ is divided by 19, so $x = 19q + r,$ where $0 \le r \le 18.$  Then
\begin{align*}
\lfloor x \rfloor - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{x}{19} \right\rfloor &= 19q + r - 19 \left\lfloor \frac{19q + r}{19} \right\rfloor \\
&= 19q + r - 19 \left\lfloor q + \frac{r}{19} \right\rfloor \\
&= 19q + r - 19q \\
&= r.
\end{align*}Thus, when $x$ is divided by 19, the remainder is 9.  In other words, $x$ is 9 more than a multiple of 19.

Similarly, when $x$ is 9 more than a multiple of 89.  Since 19 and 89 are relatively prime, $x$ is 9 greater than a multiple of $19 \cdot 89 = 1691.$  Since $x$ is greater than 9, the smallest possible value of $x$ is $1691 + 9 = \boxed{1700}.$
